pageContext.description: Socketed ax head with single loop, roughly rectangular at mouth, with quadrangular body, widening to slightly curved cutting edge.  Moulded at mouth with second and third lighter mouldings below.  Marked casting seam on both sides.  Cutting edge damaged
pageContext.patina: Dull green patina, pitted to show lighter shade of green below
pageContext.other: Measurements converted from inches to mm and ounces to grams. Width specified as: "at cutting edge."
pageContext.associations: Worked flint found in field immediately S. on site of Roman villa.
pageContext.collection: Newark-on-Trent Municipal Museum., Accession no: 786-1, Presented in 1913 by R. Woolley, Esq,, brother of the Finder, T.C.S. Woolley,, of Collingham, Notts.
pageContext.site: Lincolnshire, Potter Hill, Norton Disney, Found c. 1910 in S.W. corner of field bounded by the Fosse Way on the N.W. and by Folly Lane, leading to Norton Disney village, on the W. Nat. Grid Ref. SK. 858604
pageContext.toSearch: Norton Disney, Lincoln, Lincolnshire Ln6, UK
